page.title: 01Greater Cumbrae Island Nth
page.content:
Area comprises mainly farmland and north coast of island. The land is mainly grazing intensified for beef cattle.
The only access point to the island from the mainland is served by roll on roll off ferry service which runs every 15minutes during summer month and every hour during winter month. National water sports centre is located near ferry terminal. Sailing and cruising are main activities although all water sports organised tuition is available. The highest point on the Island (127 metres) overlook Clyde Estuary with panoramic Views for 100 miles.
